graphs
Class BiclusVis

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              graphs.JProcessingPanel
                  graphs.BiclusVis
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable
public class BiclusVis
extends JProcessingPanel

This class visualizes biclusters as overlapping hulls on a force-directed graph layout. It manages force-directed layout, graph displaying and parameter changes.

Author:
Roberto Therón & Rodrigo Santamaría
See Also:
Serialized Form

 void doLayout()
          Computes the current layout of the graph depending on the position of nodes, following a force directed layout in which: 1) All nodes connected are attracted by a Spring force 2) Every node is repulsed by every other node by a Gravitational force

updateGraph

public void updateGraph(BiclusterSelection bs)
Updates this graph by showing only the biclusters that contains any of the genes or conditions selected.

Parameters:
bs - BiclusterSelection to update the graph

doLayout

public void doLayout()
Computes the current layout of the graph depending on the position of nodes, following a force directed layout in which: 1) All nodes connected are attracted by a Spring force 2) Every node is repulsed by every other node by a Gravitational force

Overrides:
doLayout in class java.awt.Container

increaseStiffness

public void increaseStiffness()
Slightly increases the stiffnes of spring forces

decreaseStiffness

public void decreaseStiffness()
Slightly decreases the stiffnes of spring forces

increaseOverlapThreshold

public void increaseOverlapThreshold()
Increases by one unit the overlap threshold. Biclusters with less connections (counting as connection each node overlap with other bicluster) than this threshold will not be drawn

decreaseOverlapThreshold

public void decreaseOverlapThreshold()
Decreases by one unit the overlap threshold. Biclusters with less connections (counting as connection each node overlap with other bicluster) than this threshold will not be drawn

increaseNodeThreshold

public void increaseNodeThreshold()
Increases by one unit the overlap node threshold. Nodes grouped by less biclusters than this threshold will not be drawn

decreaseNodeThreshold

public void decreaseNodeThreshold()
Decreases by one unit the overlap node threshold. Nodes grouped by less biclusters than this threshold will not be drawn

complete2radial

public void complete2radial()
Changes from complete graph to radial graph. Complete graph builds biclusters as maximal subgraphs, while radial graph connects all nodes in the bicluster to a central dummy node

radial2complete

public void radial2complete()
Changes from radia graph to complete graph. Complete graph builds biclusters as maximal subgraphs, while radial graph connects all nodes in the bicluster to a central dummy node

pause

public void pause()
Pauses or resumes BiclusVis computing of doLayout().

zoomIn

public void zoomIn()
Zooms in the visualization TODO: Still in development

zoomOut

public void zoomOut()
Zooms out the visualization TODO: Still in development

Increases G constant for gravitational force by 0.5

decreaseG

public void decreaseG()
Decreases G constant for gravitational force by 0.5

search

public int search(java.lang.String text,
                  boolean searchInGroups)
Searchs for and highlights the specified text in nodes and/or groups. If the searched text is only present in one node/group, the visualization centers on it

Parameters:
text - Text to search for
searchInGroups - If true, search in made in group names, otherwise it is done in node names
Returns:
The number of occurences that contain the input text

isRadial

public boolean isRadial()

Returns:

setRadial

public void setRadial(boolean radial)
Sets the biclusters build mode

Parameters:
radial - if true, radial mode is used (a dummy node for each cluster joined to each node in the cluster), otherwise, complete mode is used (all nodes are connected with every other node in the cluster)

setAbsoluteLabelSize

public void setAbsoluteLabelSize(boolean absoluteLabelSize)
Sets if node label is used to convey the degree of connection of nodes. If this is the case, standard label size is increased by the number of groups in which it is minus 1

Parameters:
absoluteLabelSize - true if we want node size to convey the degree of connection of nodes, false otherwise
